info.document:
Reuters sports schedule at 0001 GMT on Saturday:

SOCCER
Premier League
Crystal Palace       v Southampton              (1130)
Huddersfield Town    v Leicester City           (1400)
Liverpool            v Burnley                  (1400)
Newcastle United     v Stoke City               (1400)
Watford              v Manchester City          (1400)
West Bromwich Albion v West Ham United          (1400)
Tottenham Hotspur    v Swansea City             (1630)
Free-scoring City look to inflict first defeat on Watford
LONDON - Manchester City, fresh from big wins over Liverpool and Feyenoord, face unbeaten Watford, while Tottenham Hotspur seek their first home win of the season at Wembley against Swansea City. (SOCCER-ENGLAND/, expect by 1630 GMT/12:30 PM ET, 600 words)
We will also have mini match reports on all games

Hodgson begins Palace reign after De Boer sacking
LONDON - Former England manager Roy Hodgson begins his reign at Crystal Palace, who sacked his predecessor Frank de Boer after four games, at home to Southampton. (SOCCER-ENGLAND-CRY-SOU/ expect by 1330 GMT/9:30 AM ET by Rex Gowar, 400 words)

La Liga
Levante         v Valencia         (1100)
Getafe          v Barcelona        (1415)
Real Betis      v Deportivo Coruna (1630)
Atletico Madrid v Malaga           (1845)
Barca look to make it five in a row
MADRID - La Liga pacesetters Barcelona visit Getafe in search of a fifth consecutive win in all competitions, and Atletico Madrid begin a new era at the 68,000 capacity Wanda Metropolitano stadium against Malaga. (SOCCER-SPAIN/ expect by 1630 GMT/12.30 PM ET, 500 words)
Serie A
Crotone       v Inter Milan      (1300)
Fiorentina    v Bologna          (1600)
AS Roma       v Verona           (1845)
Inter out to make it four in a row
Inter Milan will look to maintain their perfect record with a fourth straight victory when they face Crotone, who are yet to win this season. (SOCCER-ITALY/ expect by 2045 GMT/4.45 PM ET, 400 words)

Bundesliga
Eintracht Frankfurt v FC Augsburg               (1330)
FC Bayern Munich    v Mainz                     (1330)
VfB Stuttgart       v VfL Wolfsburg             (1330)
Werder Bremen       v FC Schalke 04             (1330)
RB Leipzig          v Borussia Moenchengladbach (1630)
Bayern look to rebound
Bayern Munich, who lost to Hoffenheim in their last Bundesliga encounter, will look to rebound at home to Mainz. (SOCCER-GERMANY/, expect by 1530 GMT/11.30 AM ET, 400 words)

Ligue 1
Monaco               v Racing Strasbourg   (1500)
Dijon FCO            v St Etienne          (1800)
En Avant de Guingamp v Lille               (1800)
ESTAC Troyes         v Montpellier HSC     (1800)
Nantes               v Caen                (1800)
PARIS - French champions Monaco look to bounce back from a 4-0 thrashing by Nice last weekend when they take on promoted RC Strasbourg. (SOCCER-FRANCE/ expect by 2000 GMT/4 PM ET, 400 words)

OLYMPICS
131st IOC session
Evidence found in Sochi drugs probe to charge athletes - IOC
LIMA - A first batch of athletes suspected of having been part of a Russian doping ring at the Sochi 2014 Winter Games may soon be charged by the International Olympic Committee (IOC), the head of the investigation said on Friday. (OLYMPICS-IOC/WADA, moved, by Karolos Grohmann, 400 words)

MOTOR RACING
Singapore Grand Prix qualifying
Ricciardo has his sights on pole position
SINGAPORE - Australian Daniel Ricciardo has a good chance of putting his Red Bull on pole position after setting a record pace in practice. Mercedes' championship leader Lewis Hamilton and Ferrari's Sebastian Vettel are sure to be in the fight. (MOTOR-F1-SINGAPORE/, (PIX, TV), expect by 1300 GMT/9 AM ET, by Abhishek Takle, 500 words)
We will also have stories from around the paddock

RUGBY
Rugby Championship
New Zealand v South Africa (0735)
Australia v Argentina, Canberra (1000)
Physical encounter expected in All Blacks-Springboks clash
AUCKLAND - Physicality is expected to be at a premium when the Springboks and All Blacks clash in their Rugby Championship match at North Harbour Stadium.(RUGBY-UNION-CHAMPIONSHIP-NZL-ZAF/ (PIX), expect by 1000 GMT/6 AM ET, by Greg Stutchbury, 400 words)

Rebuilding Wallabies, Pumas desperate for maiden win
CANBERRA - Australia and Argentina are in the process of rebuilding towards the 2019 World Cup but test rugby is a results-based business and both will be desperate for a first Rugby Championship win of the season when they meet in Canberra. (RUGBY-UNION-CHAMPIONSHIP-AUS-ARG/ (PIX), expect from 1200 GMT/6 AM ET, by Nick Mulvenney, 400 words)
We will also move spot news and sidebars on merit

GOLF
PGA Tour: BMW Championship (to 17), Lake Forest, Illinois
Leishman leads by three at Conway Farms
After rounds of 62 and 64, Australian Marc Leishman takes a three-shot lead over compatriot Jason Day and American Rickie Fowler into the third round at Conway Farms, where 70 players are vying to be among the 30 to advance to the Tour Championship and a chance of collecting the $10 million bonus awarded to the winner of the season-long points competition. (GOLF-BMW/, expect by 2300 GMT/7 PM ET, 400 words)

LPGA Tour: Evian Championship (to 17), France
Park out in front in Evian
South Korea's Park Sung-hyun takes a two-shot lead over Thailand's Moriya Jutanugarn into the second round of the fifth and final major of the year, at Evian Golf Club. (GOLF-WOMEN/EVIAN, expect by 2000 GMT/4 PM ET, 300 words)

BOXING
Alvarez faces Golovkin in middleweight showdown
Lineal and Ring Magazine middleweight champion Canelo Alvarez (49-1-1, 34 KOs) faces WBC/WBA/IBF/IBO middleweight champion Gennady "GGG" Golovkin (37-0, 33 KOs) in Las Vegas in a battle for the middleweight championship of the world. (BOXING-MIDDLEWEIGHT/ALVAREZ-GOLOVKIN (TV), expect by 0500 GMT/1 AM ET, 350 words)

TENNIS
France host Serbia in Davis Cup semis
LILLE - With the tie level at 1-1, day two of the Davis Cup semi-final between France and Serbia is the doubles with French duo Pierre-Hugues Herbert and Nicolas Mahut playing Filip Krajinovic and Nenad Zimonjic. (TENNIS-DAVISCUP-FRA-SRB/ (PIX, TV), 400 words)

Belgium host Australia in Davis Cup semis
BRUSSELS - Belgium's Ruben Bemelmans and Arthur De Greef take on Australians John Peers and Jordan Thompson in their Davis Cup semi-final doubles match with the tie locked at 1-1. (TENNIS-DAVISCUP-BEL-AUS/ (PIX, TV), 400 words)

BASEBALL
Dodgers, Nationals meet up in DC
The Los Angeles Dodgers and Nationals square off in Washington in a meeting of division leaders and the New York Yankees are home to AL East rivals the Baltimore Orioles in two of the 15 games on the Major League Baseball schedule. (BASEBALL-MLB-HIGHLIGHTS/, expect by 0530 GMT/1:30 AM ET, by The Sports Xchange, 800 words)

NORTH AMERICAN SPORTS
Roundups of off-field developments in the major North American professional sports leagues. (expect by 0000 GMT/8 PM ET, by The Sports Xchange, 500 words) (Asia desk editor: Peter Rutherford)
